sentence: Postal workers are some of the most innovative people around they really push the envelope.
explanation: An envelope can refer to a flat, usually rectangular or square paper container used to enclose a letter. It can also mean the outer layer to seal off an area or concept.
first_new_sentence: The letter was carefully placed into the envelope before being mailed.
second_new_sentence: The scientists studied the envelope of the atmosphere when monitoring climate changes.
